content: Hello ! Just a quick question, are you planning to make rust-analyzer repository eligible for hacktoberfest ?
Not really -- I'll have little time for code review for at least a couple of weeks more :(
Oh ok :( I understand ! Thanks for your answer
Still, merged/accepted/labelled PRs are still eligible, so it doesn't mean that contributions don't count
I'm not sure what accepted means, since IIRC anyone can accept a PR, even if they're not a collaborator
Right, sorry. But they're thinking of changing this, e.g. https://github.com/digitalocean/hacktoberfest/issues/609#issuecomment-703177333

Maybe we could have a hacktoberfest-accepted label and apply it to PRs filed this month. We had e.g. https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/6115 was a first contribution and mentioned the event. It shouldn't bring in too much spam since the repository still won't show up in search.
I can add the label, I don't see any reason not to have it
